Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2010 07:01PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi everyone, I haven't posted for a while, but when I heard about this on the news tonight I had to come and check out what my girls were saying.  I've been on Avastin and Arimidex (clinical trial) for two years.  The side effects of Avastin are horrible - I am due to go for treatment tomorrow and I am anxious to hear what my Onc. has to say.  I guess anxious is the key word because from what I understand he is limited as to what he can give me for stage iv... I'll keep you posted to my situation.
Posts.Title: FDA May Drop Avastin, Does Little To Help Breast Cancer Patients dhmeiser gpawelski

Posts.Content: May 22, 2008 03:43PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi, I take Avastin and Arimidex every other week and while its hard to say where the side effects are coming from  I do have nosebleeds but not profuse (using a saline spray helps), my joints ache some (but its tolerable), my blood pressure spikes but can be controlled, and a lot of fatigue.  My onc also gives me zometa every three months. Hope I've helped some
Posts.Title: Surprise AVASTIN tx today! badboob67 ali_lpn

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2009 07:01PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi All Haven't posted in quite a while.  I'm stage IV with mets to bone (thoracic & lumbar spine, hips, clavical, ribs).  Original diag 16 years ago, recurrance Nov 2007.  Have been on Arimidex and Avastin for approx one year (every other week) and Zometa every three months.  Have been experiencing lots of pain in right hip  (approx waist area) since October and its gotten progressively worse.  Onc sent me for CAT scan and (I don't have my copy of results yet) he said there are two new areas on pelvic area and because of severe pain in hip he ordered MRI for next Friday - the 6th.  He is suggesting I may need radiation.  I've never had radiation and it scares me a LOT!  Can anyone share the type of side effects I can expect?  I've read you don't lose your hair but it may burn your skin or cause fatigue.   Also, what exactly does the radiation do to the cancer (bone)? What does it kill? Thanks in advance for your answers Blessings!
Posts.Title: PET/CT shows bone and liver mets marshakb nancyc

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2007 05:48PM sunrizes2 wrote: So true Shirlann!  I'll just be an anxious wreck until the testing is done and I have a final diagnosis and can begin treatment!  Its the waiting that is so hard.  Will be away from Sunday until Thursday and will see the doc on Fri.  I'll let everyone know what I find out.  Have a Merry Merry Christmas.  Til then...
Posts.Title: Recurrence~~ I'm so confused sunrizes2 sunrizes2

Posts.Content: May 5, 2008 04:39PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi Mimi I'm no expert but I've been told the CAT is more accurate than bone scan as far as mets to bone. I just had bone scan and CAT this week.  Bone scan was clean but met showed up on hips, lumbar spine & ribs.  That is just my experience.  Best of luck to your Mom Hugs!!
Posts.Title: CAT scan and Bone Mets mimi1030 Maya1

Posts.Content: sunrizes2 wrote: Hi everyone! I had invasive lobular breast cancer in 1993; radical mastectomy; reconstruction; and chemo.  Have done pretty well all of these years.  A 2.5 cent. mass was detected behind stomach, not attached to anything, and biopsied resulting in a recurrence of breast cancer.  Onc. said I will need bone scan, mri of breast area, and he needs to  know HER2 status.  I don't know why he doesn't have that yet.  Doesn't that show on the original biopsy?? The biopsy was done on Dec 7 and he gave me results on the 12th.  Today is the 20th!  He told me it is ER+.  This waiting is awful.  My appointment with him isn't until the 28th of Dec but he said he'd call if he got results before.  He thinks I'll need radiation & chemo.  Waiting is so hard!! lil ole me Dx 11/7/2007, ILC, 3cm, Stage IV, 0/25 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2007 05:47AM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi Nash and all Boy, looks like a wealth of info on those links...thank you - problem is that all of it is way above my head - As far as going to the ovaries, no chance, you see I had ovarian cancer 5 years before the breast, and no it wasn't a met to breast, two separate cancers.  Hit by that train twice, now three times. So that also leaves me postmeno.
Posts.Title: Recurrence~~ I'm so confused sunrizes2 sunrizes2

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2007 03:40PM sunrizes2 wrote: I don't know about being a trooper Nash, we just do what we have to do. I am looking at your stats..when I had my first go round with br ca  they said I was ER neg.  This current one is ER+ - Onc thinks the previous reading was a false reading.  I asked if this one could be false and he said no.  They did not get a HER2 the first time.  It just said HER2 unknown.

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2007 06:35PM - edited Dec 31, 2007 05:23AM by sunrizes2 Hi again, Onc is sending me for bone scan next week.  He said he believes the ca is contained to the abdominal area and is slow growing (14 years!) so he is going to treat with Herceptin and and another pill.  The HER2 came back as 1.4 neg but not definitive so he sent if back for FISH test.  I'm glad I don't have to go thru chemo/rad again.  That's it for now.
Posts.Title: Recurrence~~ I'm so confused sunrizes2 sunrizes2

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 01:54PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi LuAnn - Its been a while! Nice to hear from you again.  In my fantasy world I'd like the same kind of Onc...LOL.  I think I could have posted a better question, I don't want my Onc to treat everything, just the things I feel may be related to either the cancer or side effects of treatment.  When I ask him about a side effect, such as... nosebleeds when I first started getting them, his response was, "I haven't heard of that side effect", or when I lost my voice totally and he can barely hear me, he'll say "lost your voice again?"  I asked him months ago why I was losing my voice because it never happened before I started treatment and he said "I'll check into it for you" and he never did.  Its those kinds of things that drive me up the wall with frustration.  I too have copied my family phys. all test results and see her occassionally, but will start seeing her more frequently.
Posts.Title: How do you feel about your Onc? sunrizes2 OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2008 02:06PM sunrizes2 wrote: Wow Watson, I want your Onc!! Ellie you put a smile on my face re: the whirling dervish!!!  And Oh Althea, my heart goes out to you! I certainly understand your frustration.  Are you able to find a holistic  doctor in your area, one who takes care of the whole body in conjunction with any treatment you are getting?  That is my dream for nutrition etc. but I can't afford it. My community is small but about an hour away from a larger city.  I am not at the point where I want to start all over again, and then there is the thing about the Clinical Trial I'm on.  I dont know about transferring...A thyroid test is a simple blood test.  I went to my primary care doc today and she wrote the script to have one done this week.  River you inspire me when I read you also have stage IV and it is five years later!! Thumbs Up!!!  Thank you all for taking the time to write of your experiences with your Onc's Blessings!
Posts.Title: How do you feel about your Onc? sunrizes2 OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2008 03:22PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi everyone! Its so interesting to read the cornucopia of opinions regarding oncs and their staff.   Some of the readings have been funny, some have been very informative and some pretty sad. At least I know mine is not so bad.  I just don't 'get him' yet.  I.E., yesterday when I went for treatment I passed him in the hall and he said "hi, how are ya?"  I said in a whisper because thats all of the voice I had at the time (my voice come and goes all the time and I never know from one minute to the next if I'll even have a voice) anyway, I said "Can you please look into this voice situation  and let me know what's going on with it when I see you in two weeks?"  Now here is the frustrating part for me.  I inquired about this at least 6 months ago when it started to come and go and he said "Gee, I don't know" and said it each of the next 3 times I inquired.  So yesterday he said "Oh, its the Avastin"  I said, "really?  is it?" He said "yes" and then went into some scientific explanation about swelling of the esophageal ?***&^%$$ of which I didn't understand at all.  I just 'got it' that it is common and he's not worried.  BUT, my point is, he never followed up and told me prior to yesterday. Thats the stuff I don't like..ugh!
Posts.Title: How do you feel about your Onc? sunrizes2 OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 07:50PM sunrizes2 wrote: I can't tell you all how much your responses mean to me.  I find more info here on these boards than anywhere else.  All of your responses have given me a lot to think about as far as what I should and should not expect from my onc..  I have an appointment with my Primary Care doc tomorrow for a antidepressant and I will bring up a few other things which have been bothering me and see what she says.  Sometimes I don't know if a particular problem I am having is cancer related or not. I wish, like some of you, the my onc office had a PA...that would be so helpful.  The head onc nurse is awesome but she really runs her little tail off. thank you again for your time and responses Blessings to all of you sweet women!
Posts.Title: How do you feel about your Onc? sunrizes2 OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: sunrizes2 wrote: Hi Everyone,  I don't know if it is just me or if others have this problem.  I am not comfortable with my Onc. I know his primary concern is, and should be, my cancer, but I have some problems with SE and it seems he just doesn't care.  If it doesn't have to do with cancer he doesn't want to hear it.  To be fair, my weight is an issue and he is watching it  as I lose more and more. I am on a clinical trial and I think he should be more concerned about the side effects as I think he has to report to the pharmaceutical company periodically. I once asked him who I contact when I am having a problem, him or my family doc, and he said if it is cancer related him, otherwise her. Well, sometimes I don't know!  Anyway, I am very depressed recently and need a prescription, I called and asked his onc. nurse and she said to call my family doc.  I thought that was one thing he could do as I imgine it is quite common with cancer patients, especially stage IV. Your thoughts will be appreciated a lot. Thanks in advance lil ole me Dx 11/7/2007, ILC, 3cm, Stage IV, 0/25 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How do you feel about your Onc? sunrizes2 OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 12:09PM sunrizes2 wrote: Wow, I just got back from church and found all of your wonderful postings.  Thank each and every one of you for your responses.  I guess I was spoiled the first time around (15 years ago in Miami) because all of my docs spoke to each other and it was great.  Kinda like your team Sunshine  - I am new in this area and these docs are new to me. I don't want to switch to another practice, I just want to know what the experience of others is like, if I am expecting too much from my onc. I guess I should rely on my  family doc more.  Would like to hear more feedback from others. Linda

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2008 03:19PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi everyone!! I am on a clinical trial of Avastin & Arimidex since Dec 07.  I take Avastin by IV every other week and Arimidex pill every night.  I got my port March 21, 07 and had to wait until the 8th day before they could give me the Avastin using the port.  I am so thankful for the port!  My poor left arm couldn't take much more!! How is everyone doing on the Avastin?  I would love to compare notes.  I have started having lumbar spine pain but don't know if it is arthritis (which I have) or the met to the area (which he says I also have).  Don'tcha get tired of wondering if its ca or just a normal pain?  For that matter, is anything 'normal' any more? Blessings to all!!
Posts.Title: surgery before Avastin. riverinerabbit sunrizes2

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 08:21PM - edited Aug 10, 2008 08:22PM by sunrizes2 Hi Kasey I have thought about it, thats one reason I came to the boards, to see if I was thinking clearly, expecting too much or what.  The problem is there are two major offices in my area.  My onc is the head of one of the offices and then there is another satellite office about 15 miles away.  But they are all the same office and that would make me VERY uncomfortable to change now. Plus even if there was another onc in the area I think they have to have special approval for these clinical trials.   But the example you gave is what I am taking about, he just kinda blows it off when I talk about problems with se's.  Like you I've learned so much from these boards, and have so much gratitude for you girls and the knowledge and experience you share.  Hopefully I'll be able to help some too. Linda

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2009 07:05PM sunrizes2 wrote: Hi Bethie Thanks so much for replying.  When you say with each course of radiation the fatigue seems worse, do you mean on a daily basis or do you mean if you have rad now and then need it again in 6 months fatigue hits you harder? Also, do you understand how radiation works?  How does it help with pain? What exactly does radiation do? I assumed it killed cancer cells but then it much kill good cells too so what does it do to the bone and surrounding area?  Like I said, I am scared, worried and its helpful to talk to someone who has been thru it.  Thanks a bunch Hugs & blessings , Linda

Posts.Content: sunrizes2 wrote: Hi Everyone! I haven't posted for a while but need some help and I know my girls will be here for me! Thanks in advance.  Just a little about me..Stage IV now with mets to bone (cervical and thoracic spine, ribs, clavical, hips) just had CAT and new areas in pelvic area.  I have severe pain in right hip/waist area and my Onc is sending me for MRI Friday.  He mentioned radiation which I have never had before.  I have been on Avastin and Arimidex for a year now plus Zometa.  I take Arimidex every night, Avastin every other week and Zometa every three months.  I am scared and worried about radiation. What can I expect as far as side effects?  Also, what does radiation do?  It must kill something but what?  I really need some input from you girls who know so much more than I.  Oh yeah, I also have a hard time with pain meds - haven't met one that didn't make me so nauseus it wasn't worth it - tried morphine last Friday and it didn't help the pain at all but did make me sick.  Thanks for your help Lots of hugs!!! lil ole me Dx 11/7/2007, ILC, 3cm, Stage IV, 0/25 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
